messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Re: Okra
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/17/2006 7:30:52 PM Central Daylight Time, pamperedmichelle@gmail.com writes: I love  all those things.  Collards, turnips (and greens),
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/17/2006 7:30:52 PM Central Daylight Time,
pamperedmichelle@... writes:

I love all those things. Collards, turnips (and greens), kale, spinach,
raddiccio, all sorts of lettuces (except nasty plain old head lettuce),
dandelion greens, oak leaves, mmmmmm. But okra is just one of the vilest
things I've ever eaten. I hate it fried, raw, or boiled. I wish I could
find one of my book manuscripts because I wrote a whole piece on okra once.
I thought I had found it earlier, but it was my collection of "Missy Prissy
and Sissy" stories.


have you tried it pickled? It is so yummy pickled.

~Alyssa
Slightly crunchy, unschooling Mom to Landen(2 1/2) and Gage(6 months)

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Re: Okra
messages.msgSnippet: ... I love all those things.  Collards, turnips (and greens), kale, spinach, raddiccio, all sorts of lettuces (except nasty plain old head lettuce), dandelion
messages.messageBody:
On 4/17/06, LuvnMomma24boys@... <LuvnMomma24boys@...> wrote:
>
>
>
> In a message dated 4/17/2006 7:08:30 P.M. US Eastern Standard Time,
> SquishyMommy1@... writes:
>
> Kale LOVE LOVE KALE and i also like boiled endive
>
>
> and just plain ole Spinach...........i love spinach!


I love all those things. Collards, turnips (and greens), kale, spinach,
raddiccio, all sorts of lettuces (except nasty plain old head lettuce),
dandelion greens, oak leaves, mmmmmm. But okra is just one of the vilest
things I've ever eaten. I hate it fried, raw, or boiled. I wish I could
find one of my book manuscripts because I wrote a whole piece on okra once.
I thought I had found it earlier, but it was my collection of "Missy Prissy
and Sissy" stories.





--
Michelle

The Pampered Chef

messages.subject: Okra
messages.msgSnippet: No one else in our house likes it, so come over one day and we ll Okra together. Oooh...me too, me too!:) Okra grows so nice and so tall. It was one of the
messages.messageBody:
"No one else in our house likes it, so come over one day and we'll Okra
together."

Oooh...me too, me too!:)

Okra grows so nice and so tall. It was one of the only things I could
grow well in Pensacola. I never did learn how to cook it, but that's
next. I always loved it fried.

Ren
learninginfreedom.com

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Okra
messages.msgSnippet: ... From: Elissa Jill Cleaveland  Kelly, I love Okra also! Especially when the little seed balls come out in the gumbo.Yummy
messages.messageBody:
-----Original Message-----
From: Elissa Jill Cleaveland <MystikMomma@...>


Kelly, I love Okra also! Especially when the little seed balls come out
in
the gumbo.Yummy Yummy.
No one else in our house likes it, so come over one day and we'll Okra
together.

-=-=-

You bet! No one here likes it either. The boys *might* eat it if it's
fried and not gooey at all, but they're not fans! <g> Ben won't eat it
if he can help it. No okra in my vegetable soup! :-(

You growing any this year?

I need to get you down here again!

I'm glad to see you on UnschoolingBasics!! We've missed you!

~K

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Okra
messages.msgSnippet: Kelly said: It s on MY good list!!!  Me: Kelly, I love Okra also! Especially when the little seed balls come out in the gumbo.Yummy Yummy. No one else in
messages.messageBody:
Kelly said:
It's on MY good list!!! <g>

Me:
Kelly, I love Okra also! Especially when the little seed balls come out in
the gumbo.Yummy Yummy.
No one else in our house likes it, so come over one day and we'll Okra
together.
Elissa Jill
